name: Plowline Raglan Sweater Pattern
description:
This beautifully easy, seamless raglan is a cozy layering piece.  Slightly oversized fit, knit in garter stitch with split side seam and colorblocking detail.  Knit in soft cotton blend, but would be perfect in a soft wool for winter.  

To fit -one size- US Women's Size 6-8:

Bust 34” - 36”		::	Finished Bust: 38”
Waist 27” - 28”  	::	Finished Waist 40”
Hip 38” - 40”		::	Finished Hip: 43”

This is a simple knit with easy construction.  Circular knitting, knit, purl, decreasing, increasing, casting on, attaching sleeves to a circular knit sweater, and picking up collar stitch skills are helpful to know.  Grafting in garter stitch for the underarm stitches is not required, but provides the best finish.   

Yarn: 1,077 Yards (18.2 Oz) of Lion Brand Cotton-Ease 	 (4) 3.5oz/100g Skeins of MC (Stone Gray) and (3) 3.5oz/100g Skeins of CC (Terracotta)  -OR- Similar Yarn That Matches Gauge

name: Small Teapot Cozy Pattern
description:
This simple, quick knit will be done before you finish your first pot of tea! Knit in beautifully basic garter stitch, this is a perfect project for beginners, but advanced knitters will appreciate it's simplicity.
  • Pattern Size:
  • Small 18oz Teapot Pattern (Teapot Size: L 6.75” x W 4.5” x H 3.5”)
  • Also fits ForLife "Stump" Teapot
  • Gauge is 3.75 x 4 over 1"
  • Knit with 100% Wool Plymouth Galway Chunky Yarn
  • Great project for using leftover yarn, and makes a perfect last minute gift!
Combined pattern sizes are available for purchase as a booklet. See other listing. A link to a PDF of this pattern will automatically be emailed to you upon purchasing.

name: Hot Water Bottle Cover Pattern
description:
This simple knit is a quick project for yourself, or makes a perfect holiday or get well gift for hot water bottle lovers! For those of you who can make a hat in the round, this pattern should be easy for you to complete. Basic knitting skills needed, including knowing how to knit and purl, increase, decrease, cast on and cast off. Learning how to do a kitchener stitch for the bottom seam is recommended, but not required.
  • fits standard rubber hot water bottle
  • gauge is 5.5 x 7.5 stitches over one inch
  • knit with dk or worsted weight yarn
  • great project for using leftover yarn
A link to a PDF of this pattern will automatically be emailed to you upon purchasing.
